# Turning Vector On or Off {#turning-vector-on-or-off .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

Turning Vector on or off is as easy as pressing a button! Vector is very
comfortable with staying on at all times. However, if you are going on a
vacation for a few days or need to put Vector in storage, you can turn
Vector off to stop him streaming data to the Cloud, and to save power.
Turning Vector off and on again (also known as \"rebooting\", or \"power
cycling\") also helps with small issues you may experience, such as
[seeing an
error](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/101-why-does-vector-show-an-error){target="_blank"}
or if Vector is [not playing any
sound](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/102-why-is-there-no-sound){target="_blank"}.

#### Turning Vector On: {#turning-vector-on children-count="0"}

1.  Start with Vector on his charger, with the charger plugged into a
    wall outlet. You can also turn him on while he is on a flat,
    stationary surface.
2.  Turn Vector on by pressing his Back Button (the LED strip) down
    hard **until it clicks. **The circular dot on Vector\'s back lights
    will light up.
3.  Vector will take about 1 minute to fully boot.
    1.  If he is already set up, you will see his eyes appear and he
        will be ready to interact!
    2.  If he still needs to be set up, you will see \"anki.com/v\" or
        \"ddl.io/v\" - see [How to Set Vector
        Up](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/114-video-vector-and-connection-how-to-set-vector-up){target="_blank"}

#### Turning Vector Off: {#turning-vector-off children-count="0"}

1.  While Vector is on, you can turn Vector off by pressing his Back
    Button (the LED strip) down hard **until it clicks** and holding it
    for 5 seconds.
2.  All of the LEDs on Vector\'s back will go dark and his will go
    blank.

![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5ea50cb704286364bc9902dd/file-kH2gVpE49J.gif)
